title: Acts Chapter 18 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Acts chapter 18 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Acts Chapter 18 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Acts Chapter 18.

questions.question: Where did Paul go after departing from Athens?
questions.correctAnswer: Corinth
questions.explanation: Acts 18:1 states that Paul departed from Athens and came to Corinth.

questions.question: Who were the Jewish couple Paul found in Corinth?
questions.correctAnswer: Aquila and Priscilla
questions.explanation: Acts 18:2 mentions Aquila and his wife Priscilla as the Jewish couple Paul found in Corinth.

questions.question: What craft did Paul share with Aquila and Priscilla?
questions.correctAnswer: Tentmaking
questions.explanation: Acts 18:3 explains that Paul abode with them and wrought because they were tentmakers.

questions.question: Where did Paul reason every Sabbath to persuade Jews and Greeks?
questions.correctAnswer: Synagogue
questions.explanation: Acts 18:4 says Paul reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath.

questions.question: Who arrived from Macedonia to join Paul in Corinth?
questions.correctAnswer: Silas and Timotheus
questions.explanation: Acts 18:5 states that Silas and Timotheus came from Macedonia to join Paul.

questions.question: What did Paul do when the Jews opposed and blasphemed against Jesus?
options: Shook his raiment and said he was clean
questions.correctAnswer: Shook his raiment and said he was clean
questions.explanation: Acts 18:6 describes Paul shaking his raiment and declaring his innocence before going to the Gentiles.

questions.question: Whose house did Paul enter that was close to the synagogue?
questions.correctAnswer: Justus
questions.explanation: Acts 18:7 says Paul entered the house of Justus, a God-worshipper whose house was near the synagogue.

questions.question: Who was the chief ruler of the synagogue that believed in the Lord with his household?
questions.correctAnswer: Crispus
questions.explanation: Acts 18:8 notes Crispus, the synagogue ruler, believed with all his house and many Corinthians were baptized.

questions.question: What did the Lord tell Paul in a vision at night?
options: Be not afraid, but speak and hold not thy peace
questions.correctAnswer: Be not afraid, but speak and hold not thy peace
questions.explanation: Acts 18:9 records the Lord's encouragement to Paul to boldly continue speaking.

questions.question: How long did Paul stay and teach in Corinth?
questions.correctAnswer: A year and six months
questions.explanation: Acts 18:11 states Paul stayed one year and six months teaching the word of God.

questions.question: True or False: Gallio was the deputy of Achaia when the Jews brought Paul to the judgment seat.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 18:12 confirms Gallio was the deputy of Achaia during Paul's trial.

questions.question: True or False: Gallio decided to judge the Jews' accusations against Paul based on their law.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 18:15 shows Gallio refused to judge matters about words, names, or Jewish law.

questions.question: True or False: Paul sailed to Syria accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila after leaving Corinth.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 18:18 states Paul sailed to Syria with Priscilla and Aquila.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Acts 18:21: 'I must by all means keep this ______ that cometh in Jerusalem.'
questions.correctAnswer: feast
questions.explanation: Acts 18:21 records Paul saying he must keep the feast that is coming in Jerusalem.

questions.question: Who was the eloquent Jew from Alexandria that came to Ephesus?
questions.correctAnswer: Apollos
questions.explanation: Acts 18:24 identifies Apollos as the eloquent Jew from Alexandria who came to Ephesus.

medium.title: Acts Chapter 18 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Acts Chapter 18 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Acts 18 teach us about the importance of combining faith with honest work?
options: Paul worked as a tentmaker while preaching the gospel
Paul refused to work and only preached
Paul depended entirely on donations from others
Paul avoided manual labor to focus on prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Paul worked as a tentmaker while preaching the gospel
questions.explanation: Acts 18:3 shows Paul working with Aquila and Priscilla as tentmakers, demonstrating the biblical principle of diligence and integrity in labor while serving God. This teaches the value of honest work alongside spiritual ministry (Acts 18:1-4, 18:3).

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged because of opposition when sharing the gospel. Based on Acts 18, what encouragement can you offer?
options: Do not fear, God is with you and will protect you
Only preach to those who agree with you
Rely solely on others to evangelize
questions.correctAnswer: Do not fear, God is with you and will protect you
questions.explanation: Acts 18:9-10 records God’s reassurance to Paul, telling him not to be afraid because God is with him and no one will harm him. This encourages believers to persevere in witness despite opposition (Acts 18:5-6, 18:9-10).

questions.question: What does Acts 18 teach about the role of fellowship and partnership in ministry?
options: Paul worked closely with Aquila and Priscilla in ministry
Paul discouraged others from joining him
Paul only partnered with government officials
questions.correctAnswer: Paul worked closely with Aquila and Priscilla in ministry
questions.explanation: Acts 18:2-3 and 18:26 highlight the partnership between Paul, Aquila, and Priscilla, showing the importance of Christian fellowship and mutual support in ministry (Acts 18:2-3, 18:26).

questions.question: How does Acts 18 demonstrate the importance of teaching others with humility and love?
options: Aquila and Priscilla explained the way of God more perfectly to Apollos
Apollos was harshly corrected in public
Paul refused to teach new believers
The teachers ignored questions from new converts
questions.correctAnswer: Aquila and Priscilla explained the way of God more perfectly to Apollos
questions.explanation: Acts 18:26 shows Aquila and Priscilla taking Apollos aside to lovingly and patiently explain God’s way more fully, which teaches humility and care in discipleship (Acts 18:24-26).

questions.question: According to Acts 18, what attitude should we have when facing rejection in ministry?
options: Shake off rejection and continue to witness faithfully
Give up ministry to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Shake off rejection and continue to witness faithfully
questions.explanation: Acts 18:6 describes Paul shaking off the dust from his clothes after opposition and turning to the Gentiles, showing resilience and continued obedience to God’s call (Acts 18:4-6).

questions.question: How does Acts 18 model a healthy balance between ministry and family life?
options: Paul ministered together with his wife Priscilla and her husband Aquila
Paul separated completely from family during ministry
Paul only focused on ministry and ignored family
questions.correctAnswer: Paul ministered together with his wife Priscilla and her husband Aquila
questions.explanation: Acts 18:2 and 18:18 show that Paul traveled, worked, and ministered alongside Priscilla and Aquila, modeling partnership and unity in both family and ministry life (Acts 18:2, 18:18).

questions.question: What lesson on prayer and dependence on God can we learn from Paul's vision in Acts 18?
options: God encourages us not to fear but to speak boldly
Prayer is unnecessary if we are confident
We should rely only on human strength
Ministry is only possible without difficulties
questions.correctAnswer: God encourages us not to fear but to speak boldly
questions.explanation: Acts 18:9-10 recounts God’s vision to Paul, urging him not to fear but boldly proclaim the gospel, illustrating the power of prayer and trust in God’s presence (Acts 18:9-10).

questions.question: True or False: According to Acts 18, Paul was willing to stay longer in Ephesus when the people asked him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 18:20 states Paul declined the request to stay longer in Ephesus, showing his obedience to God’s timing and plans (Acts 18:19-21).

questions.question: How does Acts 18 illustrate the importance of boldness in evangelism?
options: Apollos spoke boldly in the synagogue about Jesus
Believers should always be quiet about their faith
Fear should prevent sharing the gospel
questions.correctAnswer: Apollos spoke boldly in the synagogue about Jesus
questions.explanation: Acts 18:25-26 describes Apollos’ bold teaching in the synagogue, exemplifying courage and confidence in sharing the gospel (Acts 18:24-26).

questions.question: What does Acts 18 teach about perseverance in ministry despite opposition?
options: Paul continued teaching for a year and a half in Corinth despite opposition
Paul stopped preaching to avoid conflict
Paul ignored ministry for personal safety
questions.correctAnswer: Paul continued teaching for a year and a half in Corinth despite opposition
questions.explanation: Acts 18:11 shows Paul persevered in Corinth teaching the word for 18 months, demonstrating steadfastness through trials (Acts 18:11, 18:12-17).

questions.question: True or False: Gallio took up Paul’s cause and punished those opposing him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 18:14-17 shows Gallio dismissed the case against Paul and did not punish the aggressors, illustrating reliance on God rather than human authorities for protection (Acts 18:14-17).

questions.question: How does Acts 18 encourage us to be generous and welcoming in the church community?
options: The brethren wrote to receive Apollos warmly in Achaia
questions.correctAnswer: The brethren wrote to receive Apollos warmly in Achaia
questions.explanation: Acts 18:27 describes the believers encouraging others to welcome Apollos, teaching the importance of hospitality and support in church life (Acts 18:27).

questions.question: What can we learn about spiritual growth and discipleship from Acts 18?
options: Continuous teaching and correction helps believers grow in the faith
Believers do not need further teaching once converted
Discipleship is unnecessary for mature Christians
questions.correctAnswer: Continuous teaching and correction helps believers grow in the faith
questions.explanation: Acts 18:26 shows Aquila and Priscilla teaching Apollos more perfectly, emphasizing ongoing discipleship and spiritual growth (Acts 18:24-26).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul shook his __________ after being opposed by the Jews and said he would go to the Gentiles.
questions.correctAnswer: raiment
questions.explanation: Acts 18:6 records Paul shaking his raiment (clothing) to show he was innocent and then turning to minister to the Gentiles, symbolizing separation from rejection (Acts 18:6).

questions.question: How does Acts 18 show the role of prayer and obedience in fulfilling God’s plans?
options: Paul obeyed God's command from a vision and continued preaching confidently
Paul ignored visions and did what he wanted
Paul delayed ministry until conditions were perfect
questions.correctAnswer: Paul obeyed God's command from a vision and continued preaching confidently
questions.explanation: Acts 18:9-10 shows Paul received a vision from the Lord encouraging him to keep preaching without fear, illustrating obedience through prayer and trust (Acts 18:9-11).

hard.title: Acts Chapter 18 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Acts Chapter 18.

questions.question: What was the occupation of Paul, Aquila, and Priscilla in Corinth, and what does this reveal about Paul's approach to ministry?
options: Tentmakers, showing Paul's model of bi-vocational ministry
Fishermen, reflecting Jesus' call to fishermen disciples
questions.correctAnswer: Tentmakers, showing Paul's model of bi-vocational ministry
questions.explanation: Acts 18:3 states that Paul abode with Aquila and Priscilla and wrought with them because they were tentmakers, illustrating Paul's practice of working while preaching the gospel.

questions.question: In Acts 18, Paul's decision to focus on the Gentiles after opposition from the Jews parallels which Old Testament prophetic theme?
options: Isaiah's prophecy of the Gentiles as God's people
Moses leading the Israelites out of Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Isaiah's prophecy of the Gentiles as God's people
questions.explanation: Paul's declaration in Acts 18:6 to go to the Gentiles after Jewish opposition echoes Isaiah's theme of Gentiles being included in God's salvation plan.

questions.question: How does the vision to Paul in Acts 18:9-10 function literarily within the chapter's narrative?
options: As divine reassurance and encouragement amid opposition
As a prophecy of Paul's martyrdom
As a call to abandon Corinth
As a symbolic dream unrelated to the plot
questions.correctAnswer: As divine reassurance and encouragement amid opposition
questions.explanation: The vision in Acts 18:9-10 reassures Paul to not fear and to keep speaking, highlighting divine presence and protection during trials.

questions.question: What cultural or historical significance is indicated by the expulsion of Jews from Rome mentioned in Acts 18:2?
options: Claudius' edict to expel Jews due to disturbances
The destruction of the Temple by the Romans
questions.correctAnswer: Claudius' edict to expel Jews due to disturbances
questions.explanation: Acts 18:2 references Claudius' command to expel Jews from Rome, aligning with historical records of Jewish expulsions under Emperor Claudius.

questions.question: What is the significance of Crispus believing and his household being baptized in the context of synagogue leadership?
options: It shows a leader of the synagogue embracing Christianity, indicating early Jewish-Christian conversions
It signifies a political alliance with Roman authorities
It marks the rejection of all synagogue traditions
It demonstrates a social rebellion against Jewish law
questions.correctAnswer: It shows a leader of the synagogue embracing Christianity, indicating early Jewish-Christian conversions
questions.explanation: Acts 18:8 reports Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believing and being baptized, revealing significant Jewish leadership accepting Jesus as Messiah.

questions.question: Gallio’s refusal to judge Paul's case in Acts 18 reflects what about Roman legal attitudes toward religious disputes?
options: Roman courts avoided intervening in internal religious matters
Roman courts actively persecuted new religions
Roman law mandated trials for all religious disputes
questions.correctAnswer: Roman courts avoided intervening in internal religious matters
questions.explanation: Acts 18:14-16 shows Gallio dismissing the Jews’ charges as a matter of law that he would not judge, reflecting Roman policy of non-interference in religious disputes.

questions.question: How does the beating of Sosthenes in Acts 18:17 illustrate the social tensions in Corinth at the time?
options: It indicates hostility between Greeks and Jewish synagogue leaders
It represents Roman soldiers enforcing law
It shows Jewish unity against Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates hostility between Greeks and Jewish synagogue leaders
questions.explanation: Acts 18:17 describes Greeks beating Sosthenes, the synagogue ruler, reflecting ethnic and religious tensions in Corinth.

questions.question: Paul’s vow involving shaving his head at Cenchrea in Acts 18:18 alludes to which Jewish practice?
questions.correctAnswer: Nazirite vow involving ritual purity
questions.explanation: The act of shaving his head after a vow (Acts 18:18) is consistent with the Nazirite vow practices described in Numbers 6, symbolizing dedication and purity.

questions.question: Which literary device is used in the pairing of Aquila and Priscilla with Apollos in Acts 18 to demonstrate the transmission of correct doctrine?
options: Typology, with Aquila and Priscilla as mentors correcting Apollos
Chiasm, with a mirrored narrative structure
Allegory, representing Israel and the Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: Typology, with Aquila and Priscilla as mentors correcting Apollos
questions.explanation: Acts 18:24-26 shows Aquila and Priscilla instructing Apollos more perfectly in the way of God, illustrating typological mentoring in early church teaching.

questions.question: How does Apollos’ knowledge of 'only the baptism of John' (Acts 18:25) connect to the broader New Testament theme of baptism?
options: It highlights the transition from John’s preparatory baptism to Christian baptism in Jesus' name
It indicates rejection of baptism altogether
It shows universal acceptance of John's baptism as final
It represents a Jewish ritual unrelated to Christianity
questions.correctAnswer: It highlights the transition from John’s preparatory baptism to Christian baptism in Jesus' name
questions.explanation: Acts 18:25 indicates Apollos knew only John's baptism, underscoring the need for fuller understanding of Christian baptism introduced by Jesus and the apostles.

questions.question: The sending of letters to the disciples in Achaia to receive Apollos (Acts 18:27) signifies what early church practice?
options: Mutual support and recognition among early Christian communities
Isolation of new teachers from established churches
Separation of Jewish and Gentile believers
questions.correctAnswer: Mutual support and recognition among early Christian communities
questions.explanation: Acts 18:27 shows brethren writing to encourage acceptance of Apollos, reflecting early church networks and communal support.

questions.question: What theological theme is emphasized by Apollos' public convincing of Jews that Jesus is the Christ (Acts 18:28)?
options: Christ as the fulfillment of Old Testament prophecy
The rejection of the Hebrew Scriptures
questions.correctAnswer: Christ as the fulfillment of Old Testament prophecy
questions.explanation: Acts 18:28 highlights Apollos' teaching using scriptures to show Jesus as the Christ, emphasizing fulfillment of messianic prophecy.

questions.question: True or False: Paul’s ministry in Corinth lasted approximately one and a half years according to Acts 18.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 18:11 states Paul continued teaching the word of God in Corinth for a year and six months.

questions.question: Paul's farewell to the Ephesians (Acts 18:21) includes a promise to return 'if God will.' This reflects which New Testament theme?
options: Dependence on divine providence and humility in plans
Certainty of human control over events
questions.correctAnswer: Dependence on divine providence and humility in plans
questions.explanation: Acts 18:21 shows Paul expressing intent to return only if God permits, underscoring biblical themes of reliance on God's will.

questions.question: How does the narrative of Acts 18 illustrate the theme of 'God having many people in a city' as seen in Paul's vision (Acts 18:10)?
options: It foreshadows the growth of the church in Corinth despite opposition
It indicates Paul's exclusive focus on Jews only
It suggests isolation from the local population
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows the growth of the church in Corinth despite opposition
questions.explanation: In Acts 18:10, God assures Paul of many people in the city, which aligns with the subsequent conversions and baptisms in Corinth.

theological.title: Acts Chapter 18 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Acts Chapter 18 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What occupation did Paul share with Aquila and Priscilla, which he used to support himself while ministering in Corinth?
questions.correctAnswer: Tentmaker
questions.explanation: Acts 18:3 states that Paul abode with Aquila and Priscilla because he was 'of the same craft' and that they were tentmakers. This reflects the biblical principle that ministers often supported themselves by working with their hands (1 Thessalonians 2:9; Acts 20:34).

questions.question: Why did Claudius command all Jews to depart from Rome, which led Aquila and Priscilla to come to Corinth?
questions.correctAnswer: Due to Claudius' decree
questions.explanation: Acts 18:2 indicates that Aquila and Priscilla recently came from Italy because Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome. This decree is also referenced in historical records (Suetonius, Claudius 25), showing the tension between the Roman authorities and the Jewish population.

questions.question: How did Paul respond when the Jews opposed his testimony that Jesus was the Christ in Corinth?
options: He shook his raiment and said he was clean
He stopped preaching to the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: He shook his raiment and said he was clean
questions.explanation: According to Acts 18:6, when opposed and blasphemed against, Paul shook out his clothes and declared his innocence, saying, 'Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean.' This action shows the doctrine of individual responsibility before God (Ezekiel 33:6; Matthew 27:24).

questions.question: Who was the chief ruler of the synagogue in Corinth who believed in the Lord along with his household?
questions.correctAnswer: Crispus
questions.explanation: Acts 18:8 records that Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his house, highlighting the transformative power of the gospel even within Jewish leadership, consistent with the theme of inclusion of Jews and Gentiles in the church (Romans 15:8-9; 1 Corinthians 1:12-13).

questions.question: What assurance did the Lord give Paul in the night vision when he was in Corinth?
options: Be not afraid, for I am with thee
questions.correctAnswer: Be not afraid, for I am with thee
questions.explanation: In Acts 18:9-10, the Lord encourages Paul not to fear but to speak boldly, promising divine presence and protection. This reflects God's attribute of providence and faithfulness (Isaiah 41:10; Hebrews 13:5-6).

questions.question: How long did Paul continue teaching the word of God in Corinth?
questions.correctAnswer: A year and six months
questions.explanation: Acts 18:11 states Paul stayed a year and six months teaching, demonstrating his commitment to discipleship and the establishment of the church, a practice consistent with his ministry elsewhere (Acts 20:31).

questions.question: What was Gallio's response when the Jews brought Paul before the judgment seat accusing him of persuading men to worship God contrary to the law?
options: He refused to judge the matter
He expelled Paul from the city
questions.correctAnswer: He refused to judge the matter
questions.explanation: Acts 18:14-15 shows Gallio refusing to judge matters of Jewish law or names, highlighting the distinction between civil governance and religious disputes, aligning with Romans 13:1-7 on authorities and their roles.

questions.question: Who was beaten by the Greeks before the judgment seat after Gallio dismissed the case?
questions.correctAnswer: Sosthenes
questions.explanation: Acts 18:17 tells us that Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, was beaten by the Greeks, revealing the hostile environment for Jewish leaders who opposed Paul's message, consistent with the experiences of early Christians (John 16:2).

questions.question: What vow did Paul fulfill by shaving his head at Cenchrea?
questions.correctAnswer: A Nazarite vow
questions.explanation: Acts 18:18 states Paul had his head shorn because he had a vow, likely a Nazarite vow (Numbers 6:1-21), indicating his ongoing dedication to God and holiness in ministry.

questions.question: Who accompanied Paul when he sailed from Corinth to Syria?
questions.correctAnswer: Priscilla and Aquila
questions.explanation: Acts 18:18 records that Paul took Priscilla and Aquila with him, demonstrating the close partnership in ministry and the role of lay believers in advancing the gospel (Romans 16:3-5).

questions.question: What was Paul's reason for not staying longer in Ephesus when the Jews desired him to remain?
options: He must keep the feast in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: He must keep the feast in Jerusalem
questions.explanation: Acts 18:21 shows Paul declining to stay longer because he wanted to keep the coming feast in Jerusalem, reflecting his observance of Jewish festivals and eschatological hope (Leviticus 23; John 7:2-14).

questions.question: After landing at Caesarea, where did Paul go to greet the church?
questions.correctAnswer: Antioch
questions.explanation: Acts 18:22 states Paul landed at Caesarea, went up and saluted the church, then went down to Antioch, indicating the importance of Antioch as a mission base (Acts 11:26; 13:1).

questions.question: Who was Apollos, and what was significant about his understanding before Aquila and Priscilla corrected him?
options: An eloquent man mighty in scriptures, knowing only John’s baptism
A Roman official unfamiliar with the gospel
A Gentile believer fully instructed in Christ’s resurrection
A former Pharisee who rejected baptism
questions.correctAnswer: An eloquent man mighty in scriptures, knowing only John’s baptism
questions.explanation: Acts 18:24-25 describes Apollos as eloquent and mighty in Scriptures but only knew the baptism of John. This shows the need for proper doctrinal understanding and the role of teaching in Christian maturity (John 1:26-27; Acts 1:5).

questions.question: How did Aquila and Priscilla assist Apollos in his ministry?
options: They expounded to him the way of God more perfectly
They sent him away from Ephesus
questions.correctAnswer: They expounded to him the way of God more perfectly
questions.explanation: Acts 18:26 states Aquila and Priscilla took Apollos aside and explained the way of God more accurately, emphasizing the importance of sound doctrine and discipleship (Titus 2:1-8; 2 Timothy 2:15).

questions.question: What was the result of Apollos' ministry when he came to Achaia?
options: He helped believers much through grace
He was rejected by the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: He helped believers much through grace
questions.explanation: Acts 18:27 shows that Apollos aided greatly those who had believed by grace, underscoring the doctrine of salvation by grace and the role of gifted teachers in edification (Ephesians 2:8-9; 2 Corinthians 12:12).
